title: broken MIR in DropGlue(...) when compiling substrate (nightly)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code Failed to compile substrate while following [the quick start guide](https://docs.substrate.io/quick-start/). Compilation failed on rust nightly 1.67, worked on stable 1.66 ```bash git clone https://github.com/substrate-developer-hub/substrate-node-template cd substrate-node-template git checkout 10e62ab # main branch ref when this was reported cargo build --package node-template --release ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.67.0-nightly (e0098a5cc 2022-11-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: e0098a5cc3a87d857e597af824d0ce1ed1ad85e0 commit-date: 2022-11-29 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.67.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.4 ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling node-template v4.0.0-dev (/home/naps62/lightshift/odsy/substrate-node-template/node) error: internal compiler error: no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued error: internal compiler error: broken MIR in DropGlue(DefId(2:2801 ~ core[534f]::ptr::drop_in_place), Some(hyper::proto::h1::dispatch::Server) -> impl std::future::Future, std::convert::Infallible>> {jsonrpsee::jsonrpsee_server::transport::http::reject_connection::{closure#0}::reject}, jsonrpsee::jsonrpsee_server::logger::Body>, jsonrpsee::jsonrpsee_server::logger::Body>)) (after p hase change to runtime-optimized) at bb0[0]: Field projection `(*_1).field[0]` specified type `std::pin::Pin>>`, but actual type is `std::pin::Pin) -> impl std::future::Future, std::convert::Infallible>> {jsonr psee::jsonrpsee_server::transport::http::reject_connection::{closure#0}::reject}, jsonrpsee::jsonrpsee_server::logger::Body> as hyper::service::http::HttpService>::Future>>>` --> /home/naps62/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core/src/ptr/mod.rs:490:1 | 490 | pub unsafe fn drop_in_place(to_drop: *mut T) { | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: delayed at compiler/rustc_const_eval/src/transform/validate.rs:229:30 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1609:13 note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.67.0-nightly (e0098a5cc 2022-11-29) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: could not compile `node-template` ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f5155da25da - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::libunwind::trace::h47611fed84c2afe1 at /rustc/e0098a5cc3a87d857e597af824d0ce1ed1ad85e0/library/std/src/../../backtrace/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:93:5 1: 0x7f5155da25da -
